p: The most recent articles in the literature concern the application of a novel extraction procedure based on the use of subcritical butane. Although this method was applied to already known sources of 7-isopentenyloxycoumarin like Citrus paradisi L. (Rutaceae) [ 21] and Artemisia vulgaris (Asteraceae) [ 22], both reports illustrate the great potential for the future of subcritical butane as an extraction solvent. In the case of grapefruit seeds, quantities determined for 7-isopentenyloxycoumarin (234.00 Âµg/g of dry extract) were higher than those obtained by any other extraction methodologies employed so far.
